input_doc: Amazing staff, huge rooms, super comfy beds with feather pillows, giant shower, lovely products, great bar and restaurant, cool lobby with free coffee, juice, snacks and wine!!! Funky cool vibe in a great part of town, close to subways too. great local bars and restaurants especially on Stone street. i am now a repeat offender at this hotel and would chose it again. I literally have nothing bad to say.............

input_doc: this hotel is basically a homeless shelter. upon entering the building you see the clerk sitting behind a bulletproof window. outside of the building were several homeless-looking people who were waiting to also go inside. i am usually not one to judge by looks, but these people looked as if they were drunk, high, and penniless. have you tried looking for pictures of this so-called Allerton "hotel"? did you find any? NO- because it is a homeless shelter. who wants to take pictures of that??? DO NOT STAY HERE.

input_doc: When I was looking for hotels in Chicago most that I came across cost waaaay more than the Holiday Inn. I was grateful when I found such reasonable prices considering the prices of the other hotels in the area. I was so excited to find that the hotel was exceptionally nice considering the price which makes it a no brainer as to where we will stay any time we visit Chicago! We had a nice view of the city and the river below, our room was spacious, clean, and the bed and pillows were sooo comfortable! Being attached to the Merchandise Mart was great because we could walk to coffee shops without having to go outside, and being able to walk to the metro through the Merchandise Mart was great! A few blocks away is Lou Malnati's which has great deep dish pizza and on the bottom floor of the Merchandise Mart I really liked the blueberry muffin I had at Au Bon Pain. I am very happy with my experience and am grateful that I saved hundreds of dollars by staying here!

input_doc: I had read great reviews about the Alexis, but I didn't expect it to be so great! We arrived late on Friday evening and were greeted as if we were the most important people there. We immediately went up to our room, which was upgraded for us and the room was impeccable, beautifully decorated, spacious, and spotless. We had some travel hiccups getting to Seattle, so we were starving (and ready for a cocktail) by the time we checked in. We headed down to the Library Bistro for a drink and a bite to eat. The kitchen was technically closed by the time we got down there, but the chef agreed to still allow us to get something off of the appetizer menu, which we greatly appreciated. We also loved the location-quick access to the waterfront and Pike's Place Market. We absolutely loved staying here and would definitely stay here again!!!

input_doc: This hotel was very nice!! As soon as you walk into the lobby your mind goes to "aaaaah" mode. The lobby decor is lovely, very comtemporary and colorful. We stayed just one night, in a King Suite. The huge plasma tv swivels and provides an excellent view from either side of the semi divided wall. Decent amount of space for two adults and two four year olds. The bed was sooo comfortable! The sofa was as cozy as the one in my own home and it was just as nice at night when converted into the sleeper. This hotel is about 20 minutes from Beale Street and the view isnt "excellent" but the price, combined with the cleanliness and the warmth of the hotel, gets my vote!

input_doc: just came back from nyc. stayed at the hudson, and loved it! everyone was so friendly and nice, the place is beautiful, modern, chic but soooo warm at the same time. the rooms are small, but so cute and very well thought out and put together. it was a little drafty from the direction of the window, but not unbearable at night when I had my heater off, and didn't even notice during the day when I was using the heater. the patio was unfortunately closed due to the weather conditions, but can just imagine how beautiful it is in spring/summer. warmly recommed it!

input_doc:
I have stay at this hotel whenever I am in New York City on business and will when I come for leisure. The location, rooms and service is great. Very friendly and accomodating staff - greet me by name when I come in. The breakfast is great - omellettes made the way you want. Rooms are comfortable. 
I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.
One more thing the patio on street level is great for people watching in NYC. 
Don't miss out!!!

input_doc: The only thing good about this hotel is its close to everything. (like many other hotels around) It's way overpriced. The bed was rock hard. No fridge. U had to pay for wifi and after over $200/ night that should be free!!! The check in people were not experienced. I wouldn't stay here again. The paint is cracked in ceiling. It was clean which is very impt but way overpriced for this place. We had a great time but that is bc it was up to us and Boston is great.

input_doc: This hotel far exceeded me and my husband's expectations. We booked our room through hotwire.com and when we got there they upgraded us to a slightly larger room at no charge. Get this, we even had our 5 month old baby with us. Her packn'play fit conveniently in between our bed and the air conditioner which provided a lovely "white noise" to help the baby sleep. The beds are soooo comfy and the decore top notch paying attention to every little detail, nook, and cranny. For those saying that the rooms are tiny, they obviously didn't read about them before they booked. That's New York for you. The staff was much more friendly than I expected at such a stylish place and they had this wonderful service calle "The Acura Service". Tip: for a good and cheap breakfast go to the Cafe Metro just one block west or east of the hotel.

input_doc:
This is a HORRIBLE place to stay... First of all, they would not honor the internet rate(which was reduced from the standard weekly rate) and overcharged me...Escalated to Manager(Raj Patel) and he acted like he didn't understand what I was saying as a means to rectify the issue.... Even the corporate franchise owner(Accor North America) refuses to be manageable when dealing through the Better Business Bureau..
Even if I'd gotten the discounted rate, this place was horrible.. My room didn't lock (Rm #246), so I had to pack up & move my things to my truck while gone... The heater/AC unit blew out a foul odor on either setting... There were shady characters hanging around the back side maybe selling drugs & with overly dressed up women walking the parking lot.. Office staff didn't speak english & refused to address these issues described above... I wonder if the Sheriffs Dept knows of the criminal enterprise being supported by the motel Management & its Corporate entity... ??

input_doc: THIS PLACE IS DISGUSTING!!!! My friends and I stayed there just for the night before our trip to Cancun and let me tell you that we didn't even make it the whole night!!! input_doc:
We love staying at the BLVD every time we catch Joe Bonamassa playing at the Baked Potato 2 blocks away. The hotel is very clean, close access to Hwy 101, and walking distance to the Baked Potato (a small club that has great performers come and play). We can enjoy the show, drink as we please, and walk back to the BLVD.
We had friends also stay at the hotel - so we all met up before the show. It was waaaaaay cool.

input_doc: Please don't believe the hype of the excellent to good reviews because they are probably being written by the hotel staff at this particular location. I recently stayed at this hotel on 12/3/2011 and I am a gold hilton honors member. Let me tell you, the service at this location is non-existent, no room service, no valet or parking service, no respect from the staff at the hotel and when I addressed my issues with the hotel manager, she didn't want to speak to me face-to-face unless security was present. Scared of little old me??? Wow. Anyway, my experience at this hotel was not pleasant and I was inconvenienced by engineering multiple times and had to go off premise in order to get a meal. There buffet breakfast hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. so don't plan to be in your room late because they will try to snatch it from you when you go to breakfast. Check out suppose to be at noon but the housekeepers discourage you staying until then with all of the noises they make at 7:00 a.m. waking up all of the guests. I stayed at better Hilton hotels than this particular one. Go elsewhere. Room wasn't cleaned properly either.

input_doc: It has been over 3 months since my last trip to SF... I was so happy to see the friendly faces that greeted me upon my arrival... The doorman with his cheerful greeting... The bell-hop offering assistance... And the front desk clerks busily tended to each customer in a very personal yet expeditiously manor. I enjoy SF mostly because of the wonderful accomodations I am afforded when staying with the Hotel Whitcomb... One more very important point I would like to add is the visibility and availability of the management staff... That additional level of customer service that is present also makes "ME" feel that I am being serviced when it is not even required... Thank you all for another great trip!!!

input_doc: My son and I had a wonderful week long stay at the Omni on our vacation. The front desk staff, security, food service and housekeeping were very friendly and professional. We had a bay/cityview room on the 19th floor that limited the train noise and provided awsome views. Join Omni select guest for free wi-fi, two freee beverages in the morning by room service, and 2 presed items. I would also recommend self parking at the ACE lot at K and 6th for $8 weekday and walk a half block to the hotel instead of the $30 plus tip valet parking that is offered by the hotel. The hotel has earned their 4 star rating and I would absolutely stay here when I come back to San Diego.

input_doc:
After spending our first night at the Hotel Pennsylvania, we knew we were in the right area of NYC but definitely in the WRONG hotel. After a quick search, we packed our bags and headed to the Radisson just a block away. The front desk management and staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. They had us setup with a room and even provided a complimentary breakfast coupon while we waited on our room to be cleaned.
Ahhh - the room. What a difference it made in our trip to have a room with clean new carpet, sleep number beds, nice tv's with a good selection of channels, soft bath towels, free wireless internet, and a staff that is ready to serve you at all areas of the hotel.
The location is perfect if your looking for great subway access, walking distance to Time Square...
I would absolutely recommend this hotel and plan on staying there on my next trip to NY.

input_doc:
seriously one of the best hotels I've stayed in. i'm a 20 year old girl who was traveling alone and I was sooo relieved when I arrived at this lovely establishment. the staff was very friendly, my room was super clean, and the location of this place could not be better!! it's a very short walk to the subway, multiple bus stops, and the famous cable car line. it's also near a lot of great shopping, the museum of modern art, and lots of places to eat. i felt very welcomed, cozy, and safe for the 3 nights i stayed here. I stayed in an economy room (a single room with a shared bath) and I was a little hesitant to share a bath but everything was always clean and i never had to wait to shower, etc.
I would definitely stay here again, without hesitation.

input_doc: My husband and I always stay at the Admiral Fell Inn every time we go to Baltimore. We always have a great time and no complaints about the hotel. Everyone is always nice and the room is always clean. We stayed on St. Patty's day weekend. The weather was horrible the whole time but at least we still had a great time, except for getting our car locked in the PMI parking garage because they are closed on Sundays and they don't tell you that before you park there and then when you go to leave on Sunday you find out that your really not leaving until Monday after 6 am! But luckily someone had a monthly pass to the parking garage and let us in and out and we didn't have to pay for parking, Saved us alot of money. But anyway, we had a great time and always do every year and we will definitely be back next year!!!!

input_doc: This was one of the best hotels I've very stayed in. Everyone on the staff was extremely nice to me. I was at a conference at another hotel, so I was coming in late and tired. The staff made sure there were snacks left for me. They all gave me great recommendations for fun things to do around town, and treated me like a friend. The breakfast was fabulous, and the very kind man who ran it kept it stocked even when it was packed with hungry guests. My room was spotless, and the cleaning staff gave me refills on all my soaps every night. We called ahead to ask if they had a refrigerator in the room: Apparently they will in the future for all guests, but for that trip they actually put one in my room!!!! I used the indoor pool, which was conveniently open late, and just perfect for laps. This made my business trip feel like a luxury vacation!

input_doc: We were very pleased with the one week stay we just had at the Opal. Upon arriving, we were told that they were upgrading us to a suite for the night at no charge because they were out of king beds as we had requested for the first night. We found the hotel staff very friendly, and proficient. The breakfast was very good and the location was great, we took the bus down to Fisherman's wharf for 1.50 and it came right in front of the hotel. We either took the bus or walked to many other locations as well. We really enjoyed the restaurants located nearby, Tommy's Joynt was just great, Chevy's Mexican down a few blocks on Van Ness had $3.00 drink and appetizer specials Mon. - Friday, can't be beat!!!! Would definitely go back!!

input_doc: If you are looking for a value for money hotel in a prime location for just sleeping in, then this is the hotel for you. The history behind the hotel was the telephone number that made the song Pennsylvania 6500. A huge reception area worked on a ticket basis. input_doc:
I had the BEST experience at the Hilton Garden Inn - downton, which could have gone soooo negative. Accidentally locked my key clicker in the car. Valet Sean could not reopen the car with the key. He went out of his way to find a kit to get inside and unlock the vehicle and found the clicker underneath the seat.
IF it were not for Valet Sean, I may have had to spend $$$ for a locksmith and spend the night at the hotel.
Thank you SEAN for going above and beyond to help a hotel guest!!! You deserve a "customer service" award!!!!
Ms. Jones

input_doc:
My family stayed here for two nights (including my 5-1/2 year old granddaughter). The staff was great and I can't say enough about the knowledge of their concierge, Lolly! All we had to do was tell her what we were in the mood for and she had recommendations, directions and prices for what we chose. She was great since we were there to enjoy the beautiful city of Seattle!
Excellent location, walking distance to some cool restaurants and Pike Place and Starbucks every two doors was a big plus....but it's probably like that everywhere in Seattle! I will definitely stay at the Red Lion on 5th Avenue next time I visit.....and there will be a next time!

input_doc:
It was a number of years ago that I stayed at this hotel, but from seeing the other reviews, I am under the sense that things have yet to get any better.
When we stayed there, the first room that we were put in had mold all over the walls - ick! We asked to be moved, and they did so. Our first night was okay, but the next morning we woke up only to find a dead cat on the path from our room to our car. We told the hotel staff about it and they told us that it would be taken care of as soon as possible. We came back several hours later only to find the dead cat STILL there.....
SOOOOOO GROSS!!!
Don't EVER stay here.....EVER!!!

input_doc: Everything was great nice frontdesk people...........clean room............nice "free" breakfast. The only small complaint I have is that they took my creditcard and preapproved a charge for "just in case" which there were none. One day was 10 dollars and the next was 15 dollars..........what was wrong with one dollar that the gas stations usually charge??? Of course these charges were gone after 72 hours, but it did upset me. BUT other then that it was a very nice hotel............close to major highway and nice restaurants.

input_doc: This is a small boutique hotel near the mall. Lot's of shopping, dining and other alternatives. It is one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. The staff was friendly, helpful and generally fun. Fun because they can get to know their guests (due to the size). No request was denied. The continental breakfast was better than average and the evening "happy hour" was wonderful. Wine, cheese, meats and fruits. If this is an example of the "Stash Hotel Group" I will try to stay in their hotels again. Great job!!!

input_doc: I recently stayed in August, 2012 at this hotel for 5 nights, and found it to be extremely comfortable & very well managed. The staff are a credit to your organisation. Especially the room cleaners..... they are just fantastic. I was in room 782, which was newly refurbished and very quiet, which is sooooo important when u arrive very tired after a long international flight. The pool area is excellent and much better than any other airport I have stayed at recently. All in all I could not ask for more...............Thank u once again. I had a great stay. Millie1800.

input_doc: I made a reservation at this hotel for myself, my husband and 2 yr old daughter, little did I know that the walls are paper thin ... you can hear the people next door having intercourse... There was no weather stripping on the doors or windows so all the traffic noise, and bugs got in. This was only the beginning, we stayed 6 nights, every night there was shouting on the staircases by our hotel door, drunken fools in the parking lot, and people with their t.v.'s blairing at 4 a.m., all which we complained about and recieved no help from the front desk. The room itself had torn and old comforters, stained walls and not very big at all. We have stayed on Hotel circle many times, and NEVER been so disappointed in a hotel as this last trip, I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, and even though you save a little money, it's not worth a goodnights sleep, and comfort... NEVER AGAIN!!!!

input_doc:
I had the pleasure of staying at the W in June for holiday with friends, stayed in a Mega room and was fantastic, the hotel was lovely and clean and experienced some great staff. The Whisky Blu is a great end to the night, one night we watched a single bar tender serving a full bar with no problems.
The room was great, lovely and spacious with an excellent seating area to relax, the bathroom was huge. Had a lovely welcome gift from the GM, Mr Maynard wich was also lovely.
Location is great, 10 mins from Times Square and a nice walk down 5th Ave to Central Park, I am returning again to celebrate New Years Eve and can't wait to go back!!!!

input_doc:
During our honeymoon road trip, we stayed at The Argonaut for one night on 9/19. The location is awesome, and we had no problem pulling up at peak time in the afternoon and having our car picked up by the valet. 
Our room was decorated in a nautical theme, and had a view of the park next door and of the trolley turnaround. We didn't make it to the wine tasting that evening, but it sounded like a nice feature.
Beds were great, bathroom was great, and the minibar offered playing cards and other trinkets in addition to just snacks. There was also a DVD player available and free internet service.
Our window opened up, so it was nice to get some fresh air and to hear the sounds of the street. 
There's a nice courtyard area with a couple of bars and restaurants right next door if you don't want to go far, and that park has a little beach with a great view of the Golden Gate Bridge.
I'm already looking for excuses to stay here again on our next vacation. Highly recommend!!!

input_doc: I love staying here on my trips to D.C. It is close to everything and the nice "apartment" is like a home away from home. The management is very attentive - Vinh has been longtime manager and will go out of his way to meet every need. Here's the problem: The luxurious pillow-top bed makes it hard to get up and out on time. The spacious shower with multiple shower heads makes it difficult to take a quick shower. It is soooo quiet that you don't know the bustle of the D.C. is going on around you. There is a nice little store right around the corner that is the perfect place for great snacks when you want to skip your social events and park in front of the flat screen for the evening. If you don't have will power, this place will take you down. You will think you died and went to heaven.

input_doc: I was there with a truly wonderful person and the stay was made even more memorable by the helpfulness and professionalism of the staff. They were particularly helpful in recommending and getting us a booking at the Cipriani which was perfect and at all times we were made to feel special and a valued customer. Only smalll downside was the ice-machine on our floor didn't work for all the 3 day stay but on a number of occassions passing staff offered to go and get ice from another floor. Will definately stay again

input_doc: My first nights was uneventful I showered went to bed woke up had a hot waffle and went about my day.The second night I got in real late and went right to bed. When I woke up the next morning........ No hot water, put on my clothes and went to breakfast......No hot coffee, No waffle mix, Wafflle iorn was unplugged,No orange juice. Complained to the desk and the guy said the water line was broke and he would have to get a plumber. He also said he would make coffee but, It was almost 7 AM and I needed to go. When I turned in my room key and requested a receipt he wasn't able to print one out for me. He told me he would send one to my home address. As of 5 days later I have not recieved a receipt.

input_doc: The manager at this hotel, Leah, went out of her way to assist me with obtaining some important personal items during my stay. In my 10+ years of business travel experience, I have never been treated as well as I was here. I called the hotel before my flight arrived at DFW to inquire about where I could obtain the items that I needed, and Leah offered to have a hotel staff person obtain the items for me. The items were there for me when I arrived, and I was soooo grateful! In addition to great customer service, the hotel is really nice, clean, and comfy. I definitely recommend this hotel!

input_doc: Some words to describe this place: awful, gross, smelly. No one was even attending the front desk when we got there. Somebody in the parking lot, who looked like a maintenace man seemed to be working there??? No one answered the phone, looked like a deserted hotel. Wouldn't touch the bed with a ten foot pole. Ended up leaving because of how gross overall the experience was. Go anywhere else, just don't go here. Pay the extra $20 and go anywhere else.

input_doc:
We spent five days in NYC and stayed at the Park Lane hotel, which has the best location and view in NYC at a good value. It is steps away from the subway and walking distance of most tourist attractions. 
The property is a little old and could use improvments in the bathrooms, furniture, mattresses and doors (there is an aprox 3 inch space between the doors and the floor so you get to hear a lot of noise!). Some improvents in the cleanliness of the rooms would be welcome as well as a quieter housekeeping staff that seems to forget that most guests are on holiday and want to rest and not be awoken by their extremely loud chatter everyday. 
Most of the staff are very friendly and service oriented. All our requests were tended to readily and professionally. The first night we hardly got any sleep because the bed was sooo soft, but we called housekeeping and they took care of it right away.
All in all the pluses outrank the minuses of this property. We will go back in our next trip.

input_doc: Mmmm, I liked this place. Beautiful room with top-of-the-line linens and the rosemary-mint Aveda shampoo I use at home!! There was a DVD player and it also played my homemade CD-RW's, which was a BIG bonus! Everyone was really helpful AND in the know. I asked for recommendations for a Sex & the City-style restaurant and club and was really happy with my evening.

input_doc: The hotel is superbly situated right in the heart if everything. We found it easily from the airport using the BART. The rooms are what you would expect of a city hotel and although dated they have character. The staff were all lovely and helpful. We loved the fact that tea/coffee and cookies were free all day, (saved a fortune on breakfast) free internet and free iced water all day. We could go shopping take stuff back to the room without having to carry it around all day. I made a comment that the towels were old and the next thing we had new towels delivered to the room. If visiting again would defo stay here, that says a lot on my book!!!!

input_doc:
My Husband and I stayed here for the labour day long weekend. We have been travelling to NY city for almost 17 years but it was our first time at Giraffe. We liked the location, close proximity to everything. It was recommended by our friends who also love staying there.
The hotel itself is small and staff very personable. They serve a continental breakfast, there's an evening turn down service, a roof top patio which we didn't use because we weren't arounding during happy hour. Our room was very spacious, king bed with an adjacent sitting room and a little fridge in the room which we loved. Nice spot to return to after a full day of activities and shopping in Manhattan to relax and enjoy a cold beer or a nice glass of wine before dinner.
No relation to the hotel but there a fabulous restaurant next door Los Caminos, the food is sooo good and a must try is the red sangria.
Will be staying at Hotel Giraffe again.

input_doc: Convenient location within walking distance of most cultural, historical, and family oriented attractions including Rittenhouse Square, Antique Row and the Academy of Natural Sciences. Adjacent to Liberty Place with over 70 unique boutiques and restaurants and easily accessible to the convention center, 30th Street train station, and major universities. As a solo, woman traveler I felt safe. Great restaurant/bar in hotel with superior service and comfortable ambiance. Room was small but for a single business traveler it's perfect. Gym was great for quick cardio and a little weight lifting in the a.m. Filtered water dispenser on each floor. Lounge with coffee and tea, comfortable couches, local magazines/tourist info. Everything clean from the room to the lobby to the restaurant bathroom....incredible value too!

input_doc: My friends and I all decided to stay here for a bday weekend 20+ people from LA and SF. I booked a "Suite" which while I will say the space big, there was nothing "Sweet" about it. The bed was uncomfortable, poor linen and towl quality, bathroom door fell off the hinges, modern decor cheap and tacky, used IKEA at best. The bathroom was disgusting, and overall the room was just not clean nor was it comfortable. WE BOOKED out of the hotel the next morning! By the way, the whole rooftop bar access is sooooo ridiculous. They give you wristbands at check-in, which if you dont have on, they wont let you up, even if you are a guest! I am glad we partied at the Figueroa, should have stayed at the WESTIN! Waste of $400!

input_doc: We stayed in room 120 and we found the room to be very clean and comfortable. It had all the amenities that we needed. The bed was unbelievably comfortable!!!!! The only thing I could even remotely complain about was the evening desk help could have been more personable, but to his defense perhaps he was having a bad night. Never the less my stay was wonderful and I will be staying there the next time I am in need of lodging and I will also recommend it to anyone else looking for lodging in the Fort Worth area!!! Thank you so much!!!!

input_doc: I thought the location was great for Reading Terminal Market, Rittenhouse Square and the art museum. Yes, it's a little further from the historical stuff, but I thought the Marriott superior to the Hyatt Penn's Landing. The Marriott had a big, beautiful, lively lobby, with 3 restaurants. The beds were sooo comfy, the bathroom large and the shower was great. I highly recommend the "Two for Breakfast" deal, ($10 for 2). The view was ok. Be sure to request a room away from the guest AND service elevators.

input_doc:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights before my move from Dubai to Chicago. It was the perfect place for my last two nights of living in Chicago. The location is fantastic...right next to the Grand stop on the Red Line, and just a couple of blocks from Michigan Ave. There are so many great restaurants surounding the hotel, including the Webber Grill, which is attached to the hotel.
Our room was very spacious and comfortable. Lots of great channels on the television, a coffeemaker, and a good hairdryer. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, especially with the 7 pieces of luggage we brought for my big flight/move to Dubai.
So, if you want a stellar downtown location and great Hilton quality and service, book this hotel. We were SOOO pleased!

input_doc:
Between September 9-12 we stayed this hotel.
We booked a standard room.
But we were lucky, our rooom was on 15th floor and lake front at the corner.
Room is clear and comfortable.
View was perfect esp around 6 am you can witness the sunrise just in front of you.
We made our reservation over Priceline with $80/night-room.
I think it was a good deal.
Our problems were..
1. There is no (complimentary) internet access
2. We are a little far from downtown (we solved this problem to buy 3 days CTA)

input_doc: We spent 5 nights at the hotel in a 1 Bedroom Suite, which had a double sofa bed in the lounge. Great for our family as we have two children 19 and 16 so the extra room fitted in well for us but saved on the cost of a seperate bedroom. The hotel is in a great location, 10 mins max walk to Time square and just off Lexington. 5th Avenue also about 5 - 10 mins dependent on your pace. BREAKFAST at the hotel toooo expensive but plenty of places to eat and can highly recommend "LaBaguette" on Lexington so just a short walk from the hotel and also Grand Central has a fab little cafe for breakfast and all at reasonable prices. Gym at the hotel is fine for a short stay and never very busy as my 19 year old son used this daily. I investigated lots of hotels and areas to stay but was glad I chose the Barclay,

input_doc: Our stay was absolutely delightful! They let us check in 4 hour earlier than check in time which was great. Unfortunately we didn't get the room with the harbor view but that was ok being that we were in the room so seldom. The staff always very kind, helpful and always had a smile. We really felt welcome. The lobby, pool area, fitness room and our room were very clean!!! Rooms are a nice size. We traveled with our kids, 13 & 8 years old and did not feel crammed. This hotel is convenient to everything! If ever in Baltimore again I would definitely stay in this hotel.

Long story short, we were transferred to the lovely TRYP Hotel! Immediately we saw a difference in the customer service, in the presentation, and the overall experience. input_doc:
Although there were renovations going on I detected many problems,the rooms are new and nice.
Pro's - the front staff was nice and very helpful, lobby beautifully decorated, rooms were clean.
Con's - the elevator is in poor condition, 2nd and 3rd floors smelled something bad(1st floor where they were working was fine the a/c was in full blast, very comfortable) They stated that the beds were full but actually they were very small doubles. 
The doors are not study and it was a crack so that you are able to see into the hallway-and if you can see you can hear believe me, I checked at least 11 doors.The pool was the worst!!!!! I looked and smell like sewage even if it did not you could not enjoy the lawn chairs everything was nasty.
I did look inside a king room and it also seem to be nice and clean with a ref. and microwave. I would not stay in this hotel again but will visit the chain again.

input_doc:
we neamed our own price on the room and for $100 in that location around all the attractions you get in walking distance it is a goooood rate.
Our room was clean and really big with a small patio you can sit on ... (and get the free DC wifi) 
Our room wasnt ready as we arrived in the morning so the guy at the reception (Andre Hooker - he is sooooo nice) send us an short and nice email as it were ready - nice service!!!
The only thing that isnt sooo cool, the windows arent that good - you can hear the amtrak arrive and much noise from the streets around...
Would stay here again !

input_doc: Friendly, professional, helpful staff. Great ammentites, spacious rooms, comfortable beds and nice TV. Staff is extremely helpful and exhaustes all efforts to meet your needs. My girlfriend forgot her cell phone charger at home, when we arrived at the hotel i asked the front desk staff if they might have a charger that would fit her phone, they sent one up within 15 minutes of our arrival. Great fitness center and PHENOMENAL bar on the 27th floor. Floor to ceiling windows with beautiful view of the Denver skyline. You would be hard pressed to find more bang for your buck when staying downtown. A legitimate FOUR STAR hotel at an affordable price, i highly recommend staying here, you will not be disappointed!!!

input_doc:
Staying at Public Chicago is really an experience that I would highly recommend to others. The design aesthetic is chic and elegantly simple. Beautifully detailed and not overly designed. There are all the modern touches, but somehow it still has retained a sense of warmth that makes you truly feel welcome and at home (in a good way). 
The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and professional and they really made you feel like they were happy you were there. There are so many cool hotels, that have staff that make you feel like you are an unwelcome guest at their party, this was definitely not the case at Public. The common areas perhaps add to this welcoming feeling, the lobby, the library and restaurant were all very open and flowed into each other really nicely. 
I didn't eat there, but the design in the Pump Room was pretty awesome. While on the subject of food though, I loooooved the express room service concept, affordable and fast and the french toast was evil it was so good.
Neighborhood was beautiful, overall a really great way to spend some time in Chicago.

input_doc: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days for a convention and enjoyed every moment of it. Staff was great; especially Brian, the gentleman that brought our bags to our room and informed us of all the great places to go--beginning with the best food to be had a Reading Terminal Market, which is just across the street. There is a great little bar to the left of the lobby, in the hotel, that is friendly and busy, and they make wonderful white chocolate martinis! Everyone here was helpful and the hotel is quiet at night and in the mornings, if you can sleep in a bit--the beds are soooo comfortable; a cloud of soft sheets, down comforters and many pillows! If you are looking for good food, at a cool place, at a really decent price, call ahead and make a reservation at Bleu, in Rittenhouse Square. There is shopping and more restaurants even closer to the hotel , and a 7-11 convenience store right across from the entrance, for bringing snacks into your room. Will definitely stay here when we come to Philly again!

input_doc: I just returned from a short stay at the Maxwell Hotel and I can't wait to go back. I have had the opportunity to stay at wonderful hotels (Four Seasons on Lanai - Hyatt San Francisco, etc) and I must say that the Maxwell Hotel is now my favorite Hotel of all. From the moment of check in, I knew this place was special. The guy who checked me in was great and he introduced me to Mario ( manager) who was equally as great. The room had everything you could want and more. It even had a Keurig coffee maker folks!!! We had a great view of the Space Needle from the room. There was complimentary transportation to local areas. I am already planning my next trip to Seattle with a stay at the Maxwell Hotel!!!

input_doc: I can't remember when I stayed in a nicer place. The staff was very pleasant, and the hotel is perfectly located for my purposes. My room was soooo comfortable, I wish I could stay for a few weeks.

The hotel was fab. In a fantastic location in Midtown Manhattan. We only stayed in a standard room (ie not a suite) but the beds were sooo comfortable and the room was plush. The porters and concierge were lovely, helpful and didn't ask for or expect a tip once, although we did tip right at the end of the holiday. The receptionists were polite but a bit sullen and not over-friendly which was the only downside. We even got a daily $10 voucher each for a meal in the ajoining restaurant, Ferro's where we ate a lovely and reasonable priced lunch. All-in-all a fantastic place to stay and I would definately stay there again!

input_doc: If you expect this to be a "nice" hotel with amenities do not ignore the negative reviews!!! I was frightened when I walked in because when I looked out my kitchen window I had a view of a dirt lot where people were taking drugs. The heater was old and loud, almost as loud as sleeping next to a diesel engine. There were no screens on the windows. You could feel the springs on the mattress (which was about an inch thick). No wireless internet. Hotel is in serious need of a remodel. At checkin, hotel staff was incredibly rude. On busy street, very loud.

input_doc: This was a great hotel, sooooo clean I was impressed. I would give it 5-stars, except that I didn't sleep so well because the A/C would turn on and off and I woke up every time. I ended up sleeping with a pillow over my head. BUT I am a very light sleeper--my husband slept just fine, so if you're a normal sleeper, I wouldn't worry about it. Even with the interrupted sleep, I would give it 4 1/2 stars if I could. Great staff, down to the friendly housekeepers.

input_doc: We arrived with friends very late at night with lots of luggage and were relieved to be greeted at our cab by the Bellman with our room keys. What a delight to just go on up to our rooms which were huge. Seeing the rest of the Fairmont in the morning was a pleasant surprise - just beautiful!!! The lobby is fabulous and the restaurants very special. The only disappointment was not having a coffee maker in the room.

input_doc:
Stayed at the Four Points by Sheraton Manhattan SoHo Village for 3 nights this past week.
Centrally located with great restaurants and shops close by and only a 3 minute walk to the Houston Subway Station. This line takes you up to 42nd Street or down to the South Ferry.
The staff are friendly and very accommodating. Very clean and updated rooms. 
Will definitely stay there again!! A special Thank You to Newton at the front desk for looking after us!! The people of New York City are very friendly!!!!!!

input_doc: My mother and a group of women attended a women's conferance. The rooms were not clean, there were no clean towels, there was no toilet paper the maids had to remove some from other rooms, there were USED toilet paper on floor of one of the rooms, there were no clean sheets they had to go ask for some clean ones and when they spoke to the clerk his explanation was they forgot to put the sheets in the dryer. The clerk was extremely rude and unprofessional. Our church and the rest of the association will never rent rooms from this hotel again!!!!!
